item.title: Star Wars Zero Company is coming in 2026 for PS5, Xbox Series XS, and PC
item.content:encoded:
https://www.thesixthaxis.com/2025/04/19/star-wars-zero-company-is-coming-in-2026-for-ps5-xbox-series-xs-and-pc/

Earlier this week, EA announced Star Wars Zero Company which is in development with BitReactor and Respawn on board. The initial reveal just told us that we would get more news this weekend, and that moment has arrived with the game’s first trailer along with the first details. What it confirms is that Star Wars Zero Company will be a turn based tactics game, looking a bit like XCOM, set during the final stages of The Clone Wars.

The story follows Hawks, a former Republic Officer, and his group known as Zero Company. All of the Zero Company members are essentially mercenaries for hire from across the galaxy, with each of them having their own skills. You have a droid that will be to able to hack systems, a Jedi that has Force abilities, a Mandalorian armed with all the gadgets, a Clone Trooper, and what looks like some kind of assassin. They are not the best of friends and will have their own differences to work out between themselves. We get a brief look of gameplay in the reveal trailer and that shows the turn based tactical element of Star Wars Zero Company, from positioning your characters to using their abilities in the most efficient way to take out enemies. When not in a fight, Hawks and Zero Company will set up a base of operations to gather intelligence from across the galaxy using informants who will point them to targets.

“Our vision for Star WarsZero Company is grounded in gameplay design pillars that weave in the immersive Star Wars galaxy with engaging turn-based tactics gameplay,” said Greg Foertsch, CEO and Creative Director at Bit Reactor. “It’s our aim to deliver a game with an original Star Wars story from the Clone Wars era that has meaningful outcomes from player choices, and deep turn-based tactical combat with an approachable and cinematic presentation.”

“At Lucasfilm Games, we’re huge tactics fans and we have wanted to make a game like this for a long time,” said Douglas Reilly, GM & VP, Lucasfilm Games. “The best tactics games are all about meaningful choices, and we’re confident we have chosen the right squad in Bit Reactor to deliver a compelling and innovative title that is authentic to Star Wars.”

Star Wars Zero Company is set to released in 2026 for PS5, Xbox Series XS, and PC. The game is available to wishlist now.

Source: Press Release

item.title: Something for the Easter Weekend – 19/04/25
item.content:encoded:
https://www.thesixthaxis.com/2025/04/19/something-for-the-easter-weekend-19-04-25/

I hope you’re all well stocked up in your fridges and cupboards with enough hot cross buns, chocolate eggs and all the other essentials for the long weekend. It’s always a touch confusing trying to figure out if Easter will mean that everything’s completely shutting down or just on Sunday hours… so why risk it? At least today is a regular day where you can grab any extra bits and bobs. After all, using as much of the free time as possible to play games is hard work and you need some snacks!

In the News This Week

Let’s check in with the news, where the Nintendo Switch 2 has taken the back seat (outside of the Mario Kart World Direct which you’ll find down in the Trailer Park section).

  • The Elder Scrolls: Oblivion remake screenshots leak from developer website
  • Tactical shooter Ready or Not is coming to consoles this summer, whether you’re ready or not
  • Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2’s hardcore mode is out now
  • Lords of the Fallen Version 2.0 adds free Friend’s Pass, shared co-op progression and more
  • A “special livestream” for FBC: Firebreak is set for 24th April
  • Painkiller’s latest trailer showcases some of its wild weapons
  • Star Wars Zero Company is a turn-based tactics game coming to PC, PS5, and Xbox Series XS
  • Marathon won’t be free-to-play, but it won’t be ‘full-priced’ either
  • Elden Ring Nightreign’s Raider character has been revealed
  • PS5 price increases hit UK, EU, Aus & NZ, but at least the disc drive is getting cheaper

Games in Review & Featured Articles

The games in for review this week were not the cream of the carrot crop, but can still offer enjoyment:

  • Rusty Rabbit – PS5, XSX|S, NSW, PC – 7/10
  • Phantom Breaker: Battle Grounds Ultimate – PS5, XSX|S, PS4, XBO, NSW, PC – 5/10

In the hardware section, Dom might well be a convert to the stickless arcade fight… stick?

  • Victrix Pro KO Leverless Fight Stick – 9/10
  • Boyhom R36H Handheld Console – 7/10

With Indiana Jones and the Great Circle now out on PS5, we checked in on the game with PS5 Pro in our sights to see if it’s a big step up over other consoles. Meanwhile, Ade dug through the archives to hunt for some of the inspirations for Indy’s archeological adventuring.

Elsewhere, I went hands on with Crimson Desert, which brought a surprisingly deep and varied style of combat to the table as we battled four of its bosses. Nic, meanwhile, had a preview of Kirby and the Forgotten Land + Star-Crossed World Switch 2 Edition, which isn’t quite the most ridiculous game name that’s coming to Switch 2…

And Aran handed in his homework essay on tyranny & oppression through the lens of Croc: Legend of the Gobbos.

Finishing up for the week, What We Played featured Atomfall, South of Midnight and My Friend Peppa Pig!

Trailer Park

See 15 minutes of new Mario Kart World details from the Nintendo Direct – Battle mode confirmed

Cronos: The New Dawn gameplay trailer released by Bloober Team

See some of the Hazards of the Job in FBC: Firebreak

Your Achievements

What have you been playing this week?

  • TSBonyman completed the first planet in My Little Universe, but has now become obsessed with Blue Prince. The room drafting and puzzles have even infested his dreams!
  • Andrewww is waiting to play Blue Prince with his daughter, and has been struggling once more with the fleeting nature of time and the PlayStation Plus library, enjoying the start of Disco Elysium until it vanished from the library before he could finish it. Yet another one to buy from a sale sometime…

That’s the round up for this week. Hope you have a great weekend ahead and we’ll see you back here on Tuesday!
